studyDesigns.name: Study Design
studyDesigns.rationale: Protocol-defined study design for investigating efficacy and safety

arms.name: ALXN1840 Treatment
arms.description: All participants receive ALXN1840 at an initial dose of 15 mg/day for approximately 28 days, followed by titration up to 30 mg/day starting on Day 29.

studyCohorts.name: Cohort 1 (treatment experienced)
studyCohorts.characteristic: Patients who have received WD therapy for > 28 days

studyCohorts.name: Cohort 2 (treatment naïve)
studyCohorts.characteristic: Patients who have received WD therapy for ≤ 28 days

population.name: Study Population
population.description: Target population defined by eligibility criteria

objectives.name: Primary Objective
objectives.text: Assess net copper balance with daily repeat-dose ALXN1840 treatment (15 mg and 30 mg) in participants with Wilson disease (WD)

objectives.name: Secondary Objective - Copper Balance Change
objectives.text: Assess change in copper balance in response to ALXN1840 15 mg/day and 30 mg/day during ALXN1840 accumulation and at steady state periods versus the pretreatment baseline in participants with WD

objectives.name: Secondary Objective - Copper Disposition
objectives.text: Investigate the effect of ALXN1840 (15 mg/day and 30 mg/day) on the disposition of copper in participants with WD

objectives.name: Secondary Objective - Molybdenum Disposition
objectives.text: Investigate the effect of ALXN1840 on the disposition of molybdenum at steady state at 15 mg/day and 30 mg/day in participants with WD

objectives.name: Secondary Objective - Molybdenum Balance
objectives.text: Assess steady-state total molybdenum balance as a measure of ALXN1840 15 mg/day and 30 mg/day in participants with WD

objectives.name: Secondary Objective - Molybdenum Accumulation
objectives.text: Assess accumulation of molybdenum with ALXN1840 treatment at 15 mg/day and 30 mg/day in participants with WD

objectives.name: Secondary Objective - Pharmacokinetics
objectives.text: Determine the steady-state plasma pharmacokinetic (PK) of total molybdenum and plasma ultrafiltrate (PUF) molybdenum (as surrogate measures of ALXN1840, 15 mg and 30 mg) in participants with WD

objectives.name: Secondary Objective - Safety
objectives.text: Evaluate the safety and tolerability of repeated-dose administration of ALXN1840 15 mg/day and 30 mg/day in participants with WD

objectives.name: Exploratory Objective - Dose Response
objectives.text: Determine dose response of ALXN1840 15 mg/day and 30 mg/day for copper balance in participants with WD

objectives.name: Exploratory Objective - Treatment Duration
objectives.text: Determine the effect of treatment duration on copper balance in participants with WD

objectives.name: Exploratory Objective - Biomarkers
objectives.text: Assess the effects of ALXN1840 on ceruloplasmin, ceruloplasmin-bound copper LBC profiles in plasma in participants with WD

endpoints.name: Mean daily copper balance
endpoints.text: Mean daily copper balance where copper balance is measured by the calculated difference between copper intake (in food and drink) and copper output (in feces and urine) during ALXN1840 accumulation and steady-state periods for each dose

endpoints.name: Change in mean daily copper balance
endpoints.text: Change in mean daily copper balance as measured by the calculated difference between copper intake (in food and drink) and copper output (in feces and urine) from pretreatment baseline (Days -4 through -1) and ALXN1840 accumulation and steady-state periods for each dose

endpoints.name: Copper quantification
endpoints.text: Copper quantified in food, drink, feces, and urine, including plasma total and labile bound copper (LBC) during ALXN1840 accumulation and steady-state periods for each dose

endpoints.name: Molybdenum quantification
endpoints.text: Molybdenum quantified in food, drink, feces, and urine, plasma total molybdenum at ALXN1840 steady state

endpoints.name: Mean daily molybdenum balance
endpoints.text: Mean daily molybdenum balance as demonstrated through measurement of molybdenum intake (in food, drink and ALXN1840), and molybdenum output (feces and urine) representing ALXN1840 steady state

endpoints.name: Accumulation of molybdenum
endpoints.text: Accumulation of molybdenum as determined by molybdenum balance

endpoints.name: PK parameters for plasma total and PUF-molybdenum
endpoints.text: PK parameters for plasma total and PUF-molybdenum

endpoints.name: Safety parameters
endpoints.text:
Safety parameters:
• Treatment emergent adverse events (TEAEs)/serious adverse events (SAEs)
• Clinical laboratory assessments (serum chemistry, hematology, coagulation, and urinalysis)
• Physical examinations
• Heart rate, intervals (PR, QRS, QT and QTc), and clinically significant electrocardiogram (ECG) findings as determined by triplicate 12-lead ECG
• Vital sign assessments (blood pressure and heart rate)

endpoints.name: Dose response on copper balance
endpoints.text: Assess dose response of ALXN1840 on copper balance focusing on copper balance

endpoints.name: Effect of time on copper balance
endpoints.text: Determine the effect of time following initiation of ALXN1840 treatment on copper balance

endpoints.name: Ceruloplasmin, ceruloplasmin-bound copper, and LBC
endpoints.text: Ceruloplasmin, ceruloplasmin-bound copper, and LBC: Change in ceruloplasmin at Days 1, 8, 25, 29, 36, and Day 39 compared with predose

exits.name: Study Completion
exits.description: A participant is considered to have completed the study if he/she has completed all phases of the study including the last scheduled procedure shown in the Schedule of Activities (SoA).

exits.name: Participant Withdrawal
exits.description: A participant may withdraw from the study at any time at his/her own request.

exits.name: Investigator Discretionary Withdrawal
exits.description: A participant may be withdrawn at any time at the discretion of the Investigator for safety, behavioral, compliance, or administrative reasons.

exits.name: Lost to Follow-up
exits.description: A participant will be considered lost to follow-up if he or she repeatedly fails to return for scheduled visits and is unable to be contacted by the study site after documented attempts.

exits.name: Study Termination by Sponsor
exits.description: Alexion reserves the right to close the study site or terminate the study at any time for any reason at the sole discretion of Alexion.

notes.text: a. Within 42 days of ALXN1840 administration. Details of procedures that may be performed by sites designated as “screening sites” (only in the US) are detailed in Section 8.
b. Participants will be admitted to the clinical research unit (CRU) at least 10 hours prior to enrollment and initiation of copper- and molybdenum-controlled diet.
c. At the CRU’s discretion, participants may remain in the CRU or be readmitted on Day 22 with all procedures starting on Day 23.
d. Unscheduled study visits may occur at any time during the study and may include any study procedure as deemed necessary by the Investigator.
e. Participants are required to return to the CRU Day 54+/-2; participants will be discontinued from ALXN1840 medication by their physician at the latest by the Day 54 follow-up.

f. Discharge from the unit may occur after completion of all procedures on Day 9 and on Day 40 and after the Investigator has reviewed all safety assessment (including safety laboratory tests) and confirmed that the participant is appropriate for discharge.

g. A single outpatient visit or phone call and safety laboratory assessment should occur between Day 14 and Day 18. A phone call may take place on a different day than the blood draw within the Day 14 through Day 18 period.
h. If needed to confirm menopause.
i. Parameters include age and sex. Race and ethnicity will be collected where permitted by local regulations.
j. Wilson disease history will include diagnosis date, method of diagnosis, history of cirrhosis, details of any previous liver biopsies performed, and treatment received.

k. A full physical examination will be performed at Screening, at check-in for the study, and at the End of the study/Early Termination Visit. A physical examination should also be performed on any participants with ongoing adverse events prior to discharge from the unit. Otherwise, a symptom-driven physical examination may be performed at other times, at the Principal Investigator’s discretion.
l. Height at screening only.

m. While in the CRU, study intervention will be administered after an overnight fast (ie, at least 10 hours) at the same time every morning; drug is to be administered with 240 mL of water and meals should be delayed a minimum of 2 hours after dosing. As an outpatient, participants are expected to take ALXN1840 at approximately the same time daily (+/- 1 hour). Participants should take the medication with a glass of water on an empty stomach; meals should be delayed a minimum of 2 hours after dosing.
n. During the outpatient period, participants will use SMS text messaging to confirm study intervention administration.
o. Blood sampling for PK/PD will occur before ALXN1840 administration and represents a predose trough. See Table 2 for PK/PD sampling on Days 1, 25, 29, and 39.
p. PK/PD collection will include timepoints described in the schedule of PK/PD assessment for Days 1, 25, 29, and 39 (Table 2).

q. Samples for serum chemistry will be obtained following a fast of at least 8 hours at the Screening Visit and at check-in. In case of rechecks, and postdose serum chemistry, participants may not have fasted for 6 or 8 hours before the serum chemistry sample is taken.
r. Laboratory assessment including chemistry, hematology, and coagulation parameters should be performed on Days -8, -1, 8, 23, and 28 only.

s. Menstruation check is for women only; women of childbearing potential should only be enrolled after a negative serum pregnancy test result at Screening. Additional urine pregnancy testing will be started for the protocol unless serum testing is required by site policies, local regulation, or Institutional Review Boards (IRBs)/Independent Ethics Committees (IECs) (Section 10.2). In addition to pregnancy tests detailed at the visits in the SoA, females of childbearing potential will be required to perform urine pregnancy tests at least every 4 weeks at their home or the study site throughout their time in the study.
t. A single 15 mL serum sample will be retained for evaluation in the event of an unexpected safety finding; retained samples may be destroyed after completion of the clinical study report.

u. Vital signs assessments and ECGs should be performed predose, unless otherwise specified. Vitals signs include body temperature, heart rate, respiratory rate, and systolic and diastolic blood pressure.

v. Copper- and molybdenum-controlled diet will be initiated after registration/inclusion. Participants will remain on a copper/molybdenum controlled diet throughout both the inpatient Period 1 (Day -8 to Day 9) and inpatient Period 2 (Day 23 to Day 40); during this time participants will be strongly encouraged to complete all meals. While not in the CRU, participants will be encouraged to adhere to their usual copper-controlled diet.
w. For each input/output balance period, 24-hour urine samples are to be collected for measurement of copper and molybdenum.
x. For fecal samples, each individual sample will be independently collected with record of date, time, and weight of the sample.

Abbreviations: AE = adverse event; BMI = body mass index; C-I = check-in; Cu = copper; d = day; ECG = electrocardiogram; EOS/ET = End of Study or Early Termination; HIV = human immunodeficiency virus; HR = heart rate; LBC = labile bound copper; Mo = molybdenum; OP = outpatient; PD = pharmacodynamic; PK = pharmacokinetic; PUF = plasma ultrafiltrate; UNS = unscheduled; WD = Wilson disease.

indications.name: Wilson Disease
indications.description: Participants with Wilson Disease Treated with ALXN1840

procedures.name: Fecal Collection
procedures.label: Fecal Collection
procedures.description: Collection of individual fecal samples for measurement of copper and molybdenum content.

procedures.name: Vital Signs Measurement
procedures.label: Vital Signs
procedures.description: Assessment of body temperature, heart rate, respiratory rate, and systolic and diastolic blood pressure.

procedures.name: Electrocardiogram

code.decode: Electrocardiogram, routine ECG with at least 12 leads; with interpretation and report

procedures.label: ECG
procedures.description: Triplicate 12-lead ECG to assess heart rate, intervals (PR, QRS, QT and QTc), and clinically significant findings.

procedures.name: Bowel and Urine Monitoring
procedures.label: Intake/Output Monitoring
procedures.description: Monitoring of urination and bowel movements, including recording time and weight of fecal samples.

procedures.name: Cannula Placement
procedures.label: Cannulation
procedures.description: Placement of a cannula to minimize needle sticks for repeated blood draws.

analysisPopulations.name: Screened Set
analysisPopulations.text: The Screened Set includes all participants who signed an informed consent form (ICF).
analysisPopulations.populationDescription: The Screened Set includes all participants who signed an informed consent form (ICF).
analysisPopulations.criteria: Participant signed an informed consent form (ICF)

analysisPopulations.name: Enrolled Set
analysisPopulations.text: The Enrolled Set includes all participants who were enrolled in the study.
analysisPopulations.populationDescription: The Enrolled Set includes all participants who were enrolled in the study.
analysisPopulations.criteria: Participant was enrolled in the study

analysisPopulations.name: Full Analysis Set
analysisPopulations.text: The Full Analysis (FA) Set includes all enrolled participants who received at least 1 dose of ALXN1840 and have at least 1 post-Baseline efficacy assessment. The FA Set will be the primary analysis set for all efficacy analyses.
analysisPopulations.label: FA
analysisPopulations.populationDescription: The Full Analysis (FA) Set includes all enrolled participants who received at least 1 dose of ALXN1840 and have at least 1 post-Baseline efficacy assessment. The FA Set will be the primary analysis set for all efficacy analyses.
analysisPopulations.criteria: Enrolled AND received >= 1 dose of ALXN1840 AND has >= 1 post-Baseline efficacy assessment

analysisPopulations.name: Per Protocol Set
analysisPopulations.text: The Per Protocol (PP) Set is a subset of the FA Set and includes all participants who do not have any major protocol deviations that would impact the primary efficacy endpoint. Major protocol deviations will be identified and documented before database lock. The PP Set will be used for sensitivity analyses of the primary efficacy endpoint.
analysisPopulations.label: PP
analysisPopulations.populationDescription: The Per Protocol (PP) Set is a subset of the FA Set and includes all participants who do not have any major protocol deviations that would impact the primary efficacy endpoint. Major protocol deviations will be identified and documented before database lock. The PP Set will be used for sensitivity analyses of the primary efficacy endpoint.
analysisPopulations.criteria: Member of FA Set AND has no major protocol deviations impacting the primary efficacy endpoint

analysisPopulations.name: Safety Set
analysisPopulations.text: The Safety Set includes all enrolled participants who received at least 1 dose of ALXN1840. The Safety Set will be the primary analysis set for all safety analyses.
analysisPopulations.populationDescription: The Safety Set includes all enrolled participants who received at least 1 dose of ALXN1840. The Safety Set will be the primary analysis set for all safety analyses.
analysisPopulations.criteria: Enrolled AND received >= 1 dose of ALXN1840

analysisPopulations.name: Pharmacokinetic Analysis Set
analysisPopulations.text: The Pharmacokinetic (PK) Analysis Set includes all participants in the Safety Set who have sufficient plasma concentration data to allow for the derivation of at least 1 PK parameter (eg, Cmax, AUCt). The PK Analysis Set will be used for all PK analyses.
analysisPopulations.label: PK
analysisPopulations.populationDescription: The Pharmacokinetic (PK) Analysis Set includes all participants in the Safety Set who have sufficient plasma concentration data to allow for the derivation of at least 1 PK parameter (eg, Cmax, AUCt). The PK Analysis Set will be used for all PK analyses.
analysisPopulations.criteria: Member of Safety Set AND has sufficient plasma concentration data for derivation of >= 1 PK parameter

analysisPopulations.name: Pharmacodynamic Analysis Set
analysisPopulations.text: The Pharmacodynamic (PD) Analysis Set includes all participants in the Safety Set who have sufficient PD data to allow for the derivation of at least 1 PD parameter. The PD Analysis Set will be used for all PD analyses.
analysisPopulations.label: PD
analysisPopulations.populationDescription: The Pharmacodynamic (PD) Analysis Set includes all participants in the Safety Set who have sufficient PD data to allow for the derivation of at least 1 PD parameter. The PD Analysis Set will be used for all PD analyses.
analysisPopulations.criteria: Member of Safety Set AND has sufficient PD data for derivation of >= 1 PD parameter

titles.text: A Phase 2, Open-label Study to Assess Copper and Molybdenum Balance in Participants with Wilson Disease Treated with ALXN1840
Copper and Molybdenum Balance in Participants with Wilson Disease Treated with ALXN1840

type.decode: US FDA Investigational New Drug Application Number

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Criterion 1
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Participants aged ≥18 at the time of signing the ICF.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Criterion 2
eligibilityCriterionItems.text:
Diagnosis of WD by Leipzig Criteria ≥ 4 documented by testing as outlined in the 2012 European Association for the Study of Liver WD Clinical Practice Guidelines (Ferenci, 2003; EASL, 2012) or by historical test results for WD including some or all of the following: 
• Presence of Kayser Fleischer rings, 
• Neurological symptoms, 
• Serum ceruloplasmin below reference range, 
• Coombs-negative hemolytic anemia, 
• Elevated liver or urinary copper, 
• Presence of mutations in the ATP7B gene, or 
• Other, as considered appropriate, may be used instead to confirm the diagnosis of WD.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Criterion 3
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Participants who in the opinion of the referring Investigator may benefit from decoppering therapy.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Criterion 4
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Participants must be able to comply with all study-related procedures.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Criterion 5
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Participants must be able to reside in the CRU for intensive metabolic monitoring of copper and molybdenum.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Criterion 6
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Participants willing to discontinue chelator therapy for approximately 4 days prior to initiation of ALXN1840 to allow a baseline assessment of copper balance.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Criterion 7
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Participants with adequate venous access to allow collection of required blood samples.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Criterion 8
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Participants must be able to swallow intact ALXN1840 tablets.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Criterion 9
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Participants willing to avoid use of minerals containing copper, zinc, or molybdenum throughout the study duration.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Criterion 10
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Participants willing to adhere to copper/molybdenum-controlled diet during inpatient periods and willing to comply with a low copper dietary requirement during the Outpatient Period.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Criterion 11
eligibilityCriterionItems.text:
Contraceptive use by men or women should be consistent with local regulations regarding the methods of contraception for those participating in clinical studies. 
a. Male participants: 
• Male participants, if heterosexually active and with a female spouse or partner of childbearing potential or a pregnant or breastfeeding spouse or partner, must agree to use barrier contraception (male condom) for the duration of the study and for at least 3 months after the end of systemic exposure of the study intervention. Male participants must not donate sperm for at least 3 months after the end of systemic exposure of the study intervention. 
• Female spouses or partners of male participants who are of childbearing potential must use highly effective contraception as defined below and in Section 10.4, starting at least 1 menstrual cycle before (the male participant’s) first study intervention administration and continuing until at least 3 months after the end of their male partner’s systemic exposure to the study intervention. 
• Barrier contraception (male condom) is required even with documented medical assessment of surgical success of a vasectomy. For male participants who have had a vasectomy (with documented evidence of azoospermia if possible) and agree to use a male condom for the stated time period, no additional contraceptive method is required by their female partner. 
b. Female participants: 
• Female participants or female partners of male participants of childbearing potential (including breastfeeding females), if heterosexually active, must be willing to follow protocol-specified contraception guidance starting at least 1 menstrual cycle before first study intervention administration and continuing for at least 3 months after the end of systemic exposure of the study intervention. Female participants must not donate ova for at least 3 months after the end of systemic exposure of the study intervention. 
• Female participants who are documented as being of non-childbearing potential as defined in Section 10.4 are exempt from contraception requirements. 
• Highly effective contraceptive methods for female participants and female partners of male participants are described in Section 10.4.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Criterion 12
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Participants capable of giving signed informed consent, which includes compliance with the requirements and restrictions listed in the ICF and in this protocol.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Criterion 13
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Decompensated cirrhosis or model for end-stage liver disease (MELD) score > 13.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Criterion 14
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Modified Nazer score > 7 (Dhawan, 2005).

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Criterion 15
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Clinically significant gastrointestinal bleed within past 3 months.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Criterion 16
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Alanine aminotransferase (ALT) > 2 × upper limit of normal (ULN).

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Criterion 17
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Marked neurological disease requiring assistance with self-care or activities of daily life.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Criterion 18
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Hemoglobin less than lower limit of the reference range for age and sex.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Criterion 19
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Active infection with hepatitis B virus (positive hepatitis B surface antigen) or C virus (participants with positive hepatitis C antibody result would require confirmation of active disease with a positive hepatitis C polymerase chain reaction test), or seropositivity for human immunodeficiency virus (HIV).

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Criterion 20
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: History or presence of/significant history of or current cardiovascular, respiratory, hepatic, renal, gastrointestinal, endocrinological, hematological, or neurological disorders, or psychiatric disorder that in the opinion of the Investigator may constitute a risk when taking the study intervention; or may interfere with the interpretation of data.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Criterion 21
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Previous treatment with ALXN1840 or other form of tetrathiomolybdate within 1 year prior to dosing.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Criterion 22
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Previous treatment with zinc within 21 days prior to Day 1.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Criterion 23
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: The use of an experimental or unapproved/unlicensed therapy at the same time or within 90 days or 5 half-lives, whichever is longer, prior to the Screening Visit.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Criterion 24
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Participants in renal failure, defined as in end-stage renal disease on dialysis (chronic kidney disease [CKD] stage 5) or creatinine clearance < 30 mL/min (Levey, 2006).

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Criterion 25
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Pregnant (or females who are planning to become pregnant) or breastfeeding females (women of childbearing potential must have a negative serum pregnancy test result at screening).

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Criterion 26
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Known sensitivity to ALXN1840, ALXN1840 excipients (anhydrous dicalcium phosphate, anhydrous sodium carbonate), or any of the ingredients contained in ALXN1840 or related compounds.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Criterion 27
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: In the opinion of the Investigator, the participant and/or their legal guardian is likely to be non-compliant or uncooperative during the study.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Criterion 28
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: History of illicit drug abuse, history of significant alcohol abuse within 1 year prior to the Screening Visit, or clinical evidence of substance and/or alcohol abuse within the 2 years before screening. Alcohol abuse is defined as regular weekly intake of more than 14 units (for both males and females), using the following National Health Service (NHS) alcohol tracker http://www.nhs.uk/Tools/Pages/drinks-tracker.aspx.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Criterion 29
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Positive urine drug toxicology screen at Screening or on Day -8 (cannabinoids will not be tested).

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Criterion 30
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Alcohol consumption within 48 hours prior to study intervention administration or positive alcohol breath test at screening or on Day -8.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Criterion 31
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Participants unwilling to consistently complete every meal and tolerate a controlled, limited menu for the duration of the study.

studyInterventions.name: ALXN1840
studyInterventions.description: ALXN1840 (bis-choline tetrathiomolybdate; formerly known as WTX101) is a novel copper binding agent in development for the treatment of Wilson disease (WD).

studyInterventions.name: Paracetamol/acetaminophen
studyInterventions.description: Permitted for use as an exception with the approval of the Investigator at doses of a maximum 1000 mg per day.

studyInterventions.name: Ibuprofen
studyInterventions.description: Permitted for use with caution and approval of the Investigator. The dose must not exceed 1200 mg in any 24-hour period.

amendments.name: Amendment 3.1 (US)
amendments.summary: The main reason for preparation of this amendment was to clarify study procedures occurring across different sites in the US, so as to facilitate participant recruitment across different regions of the US, and to lessen inconvenience for participants without compromising the quality of the study.

amendments.name: Amendment 3
amendments.summary: The main reason for preparation of this amendment was to update the washout period for zinc.

amendments.name: Amendment 2
amendments.summary: The main reason for preparation of this amendment was to revise the exclusion criterion for a urine drug screen. Changes implemented via Administrative Letter 1 and Administrative Letter 2, as well as COVID vaccination guidance, have also been incorporated.

amendments.name: Amendment 1
amendments.summary: The main reason for preparation of this amendment was to update procedures outlined in the Schedule of Activities, remove contradictory text on the reporting of serious adverse events, and add details of an interim analysis.

conditions.name: ALT Elevation for Discontinuation
conditions.description: Alanine aminotransferase (ALT) level that requires permanent discontinuation of study intervention.

conditions.name: ALT Elevation for Interruption
conditions.description: Alanine aminotransferase (ALT) level that requires temporary interruption of study intervention.

conditions.name: Neutropenia for Dose Reduction
conditions.description: Neutrophil count decrease that requires a dose reduction.
conditions.text: > 30% decrease from baseline and Neutrophils below reference range at baseline

conditions.name: Potential Liver Injury for Interruption
conditions.description: Combination of Bilirubin and ALT elevation indicative of liver injury that requires temporary interruption.
conditions.text: Bilirubin > 2 × ULN Accompanied by ALT > 3 × ULN

conditions.name: Neurologic Worsening
conditions.description: Evidence of neurologic worsening that requires evaluation for dose modification.
conditions.text: Evidence of neurologic worsening by AEs or by neurologic physical exam assessment

conditions.name: Psychiatric Worsening
conditions.description: Evidence of psychiatric worsening that requires evaluation for dose modification.
conditions.text: Evidence of clinically significant acute psychiatric worsening which may include but not limited to suicidality, acute depression, or psychosis.

conditions.name: Pregnancy
conditions.description: Condition of pregnancy that requires discontinuation from study intervention.

conditions.name: Renal Failure
conditions.description: Exclusion criterion based on renal function.

substances.name: bis-choline tetrathiomolybdate
substances.description: Active ingredient of ALXN1840. Also referred to as WTX101.

substances.name: tetrathiomolybdic acid
substances.description: Each 15 mg ALXN1840 tablet contains 7.8 mg of tetrathiomolybdic acid.

studyDefinitionDocument.name: A Phase 2, Open-label Study to Assess Copper and Molybdenum Balance in Participants with Wilson Disease Treated with ALXN1840

transitionRules.name: Dose Titration to 30mg
transitionRules.text: After approximately 4 weeks on 15 mg/day, participants may be titrated up to 30 mg/day, following review of all safety information by the SRC.

transitionRules.name: Dose Interruption for Moderate ALT Elevation
transitionRules.text: If ALT > 3x ULN and <= 5x ULN, temporarily interrupt dosing.

transitionRules.name: Dose Reduction for Neutropenia
transitionRules.text: If neutrophils decrease >30% from baseline and are below reference range, reduce dose to previous level or to 15 mg QOD.

transitionRules.name: Dose Interruption for Potential Liver Injury
transitionRules.text: If Bilirubin > 2x ULN with ALT > 3x ULN, temporarily interrupt dosing.

transitionRules.name: Dose Modification for Neurologic Worsening
transitionRules.text: Upon evidence of neurologic worsening, Investigator and Alexion Medical Monitor will evaluate the need for dose modification (interruption, increase or decrease).

transitionRules.name: Intervention Discontinuation for Pregnancy
transitionRules.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention if pregnancy or planned pregnancy occurs.

transitionRules.name: Intervention Discontinuation for Disallowed Medication
transitionRules.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention for use of disallowed medication.

transitionRules.name: Intervention Discontinuation for Hypersensitivity
transitionRules.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention for a serious hypersensitivity reaction.

transitionRules.name: Intervention Discontinuation for Severe Infection
transitionRules.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention for a severe uncontrolled infection.

transitionRules.name: Rechallenge After Dose Interruption
transitionRules.text: A maximum of 3 rechallenges will be allowed. For rechallenges, participants who were on 15 mg QOD should be rechallenged at the 15 mg QOD dose.

studyAmendmentImpacts.description: Addition of a footnote to reference new procedures for US-only screening sites, impacting study conduct and site operations.

studyAmendmentImpacts.affectedSection: Section 4.2 - Scientific Rationale for Study Design
studyAmendmentImpacts.description: Modified a timeframe in the scientific rationale to ensure consistency throughout the protocol.
Addition of procedures allowing for US sites to act as screening-only sites, impacting recruitment strategy and study procedures.

studyAmendmentReasons.reasonText: To clarify study procedures occurring across different sites in the US, so as to facilitate participant recruitment across different regions of the US, and to lessen inconvenience for participants without compromising the quality of the study.
To align the number of days with the mention of zinc discontinuation elsewhere in the protocol.

studyChanges.afterText: Addition of text to the footnote to state that procedures specific to screening sites (only in the US) detailed in Section 8
studyChanges.summary: A footnote was added to the Schedule of Activities table to reference the new screening-only site procedures in Section 8.

studyChanges.beforeText: the inhibitory effect of zinc on intestinal copper absorption is expected to be minimal 30 days after discontinuation of zinc.
studyChanges.afterText: the inhibitory effect of zinc on intestinal copper absorption is expected to be minimal 21 days after discontinuation of zinc.
studyChanges.summary: The timeframe for the minimal inhibitory effect of zinc after discontinuation was changed from 30 days to 21 days for consistency.

studyChanges.afterText: Addition of text applicable only to the US that details the possibility for sites in the US to only perform screening procedures and not any of the remaining study procedures.
studyChanges.summary: Text was added to allow US sites to perform only screening procedures to facilitate recruitment.
